intro: Cyrtandra kawelaensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its leaves are usually ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra kawelaensis is considered a rare and endemic species, facing threats from habitat loss and invasive species.
